intro: Spergularia diandra, commonly known as the sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to conserve water in arid environments. Spergularia diandra is also known for its ability to form dense mats, which help stabilize soil and prevent erosion.
